bug.summary: Galactic Alphabet Decoder cannot handle 'x' when it's surrounded by other letters.
bug.description:
When running ciphey with an input that's encoded in the Standard Galactic Alphabet, it applies my SGA decoder. If that input string contains a word that has an 'x' surrounded by other letters (no whitespace in between), it fails to do the replacement correctly and leaves a Unicode diacritical mark (Updot) as an artifact. I'm still working on a fix for this. This is the character: (U+0307, 'Combining Dot Above', <denchmark-link:https://www.compart.com/en/unicode/U+0307>https://www.compart.com/en/unicode/U+0307</denchmark-link> ) It is part of the multi-character representation of the SGA's 'x' letter.
